title: NSquare Sum ( Easy )
text:
Given two integers N (N <= 1018) and a prime number P (1 < P < 1018), find the lowest number x such that there are not N integers greater or equal to 0 whose sum of squares is equal to x.N = 2, P = 2
x = 3 mod 2 = 1
0 = 02+ 021 = 12+ 022 = 12+ 124 = 22+ 02InputThe two integers N (1 <= N <= 1018) and a prime number P (1 < P < 1018). You have to print the answer modulo P.OutputYou have to print an integer x mod P (-1 < x < 1018+ 1) that satisfies the problem. If there's no number x, print "Impossible".ExampleInput:1 3Output:2Input:13 7Output:Impossible
